title: Make a 'Y' symbolise sharing
content:
Have a project and a client that doesnt like my first layout. He likes the wordmark itself but he thinks the Y symbolises crossroads and splitting, not sharing and collaborating, which its meant to.

He would like to see maybe 4 nodes, one in the middle, but that would make the wordmark look crap.

How would you solve this? Ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Yoobi wordmark](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155413/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_104.png) | 12.75 KB |

 [‹ Uncompromising Arabic Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155413/http:/typophile.com/node/19348 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif font suggestion to compliment Vista Sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155413/http:/typophile.com/node/40968 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cuidado

comments.content: Well, yeah, it does look like splitting: the arrows \*split\* and move apart. Put the arrowhead at the bottom, so that the arrows come together.
